description: This course seeks to equip students with an understanding of criminal behaviour and the criminal justice agenciesâ€™ response to offending in the local settings. Students will be introduced to psychological theories of criminal behaviours, psychopathology associated with offending, offender assessments, offender programming, re-entry initiatives, professional practice and research.
title: Correctional Psychology
prerequisite: Completed 80 MCs of which student must have passed PL1101E, PL2131, PL2132 and 4 out of the 5 core modules (PL3232/PL3102 - PL3236/PL3106), in which one must be PL3236/PL3106, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
